constants.gloss: the court handling the special guardianship application

predicates.name: in_prison_for
predicates.gloss: person is in prison for a given reason

predicates.name: living_with_for
predicates.gloss: child has been living with caregiver for a duration

predicates.name: wants_to_become_special_guardian
predicates.gloss: person wants to become special guardian for a child

predicates.name: how_long_before_hear_back_from_court_about_special_guardianship
predicates.gloss: question asking how long before the applicant hears back from the court about the special guardianship

data.scenario: My brother and his wife are in prison for carrying out a large fraud scheme. Their 7 and 8 year old children have been living with me for the last 4 years. I want to become their Special Guardian to look after them permanently
data.question: How long will it be before I hear back from the court?
evidences: Within 10 days of receiving your application the court will send you a case number and a date for a meeting to set out:

predicates.name: tried_to_have_child_with_for
predicates.gloss: person and partner have been trying to have a child for a duration

predicates.name: wants_to_adopt
predicates.gloss: person (and partner) want to adopt a child

predicates.name: asks_if_age_requirements_for_adopter_in
predicates.gloss: question asking whether there are age requirements for an adopter in a given jurisdiction

data.scenario: Me and my partner have been trying for a child for the past few years however with no luck. We have now decided we would like to adopt a child.
data.question: Are there any age requirements for the adopter when adopting a child in the UK?
evidences: You may be able to adopt a child if you’re aged 21 or over (there’s no upper age limit) and either:

predicates.name: guardian_of
predicates.gloss: person is guardian of a child

predicates.name: age_of
predicates.gloss: person has a stated age

predicates.name: from_country
predicates.gloss: person is from a country

predicates.name: cared_for_when_young_and_homeless
predicates.gloss: guardian cared for the child when he was young and homeless

predicates.name: wants_to_change_surname_to_mine
predicates.gloss: guardian wants to change the child's surname to the guardian's surname

predicates.name: asks_can_apply_to_change_surname
predicates.gloss: question asking whether the speaker can apply to change the child's surname to theirs

data.scenario: I am a guardian to a 16year old teenage boy from syria whom i cared for when he was young and homeless. I want to change his surname to to mine.
data.question: Can I apply to change his surname to mine?
answers: You’ll need to get the consent of everyone who has parental responsibility for the child before you make some important decisions, for example:
If you cannot get consent, you can ask the court to decide. Use the form ‘Make an application in existing court proceedings related to children’ (form C2).

constants.gloss: left side of the speaker's face (anatomical area)

predicates.name: vulnerable_adult
predicates.gloss: person is a vulnerable adult

predicates.name: received_vaccination_on
predicates.gloss: person received a vaccination on a given date

predicates.name: felt_unwell_after
predicates.gloss: person started to feel unwell after the vaccination

predicates.name: developed_paralysis_over_weeks
predicates.gloss: person developed paralysis of a body part over a period described as weeks

predicates.name: now_unable_to_talk_properly
predicates.gloss: person is now unable to talk properly

predicates.name: asks_can_claim_off_government_for_damage_from_vaccine
predicates.gloss: question asking whether the speaker can claim compensation from the government for damage caused by the vaccine

data.scenario: As a vulnerable adult I received the Covid-19 vaccination in January 2021. Almost immediately I started to feel very unwell, and over the next few weeks the left side of my face became paralysed, almost like I had had a stroke. I am now unable to talk properly.
data.question: Can I claim off the government for damage caused by the vaccine?
answers: Disablement is worked out as a percentage, and ‘severe disablement’ means at least 60% disabled.
evidences: If you’re severely disabled as a result of a vaccination against certain diseases, you could get a one-off tax-free payment of £120,000. This is called a Vaccine Damage Payment.
You could get a payment if you’re severely disabled and your disability was caused by vaccination against any of the following diseases:
Disablement is worked out as a percentage, and ‘severe disablement’ means at least 60% disabled.

constants.gloss: the speaker's childhood home in Sussex (inherited)
the speaker's family (will move with them)

predicates.name: inherited_following_death_of
predicates.gloss: person inherited a property following the death of someone

predicates.name: plans_to_move_into_with_family
predicates.gloss: person plans to move into a property with their family

predicates.name: would_sell_or_rent
predicates.gloss: person would either sell or rent out a given property

predicates.name: knows_no_cgt_on_selling_main_home
predicates.gloss: person knows that one does not have to pay capital gains tax when selling one's main home

predicates.name: asks_will_pay_cgt_if_sell_current_home_to_move_into_inherited_property
predicates.gloss: question asking whether the person will pay capital gains tax if they sell their current home to move into an inherited property

data.scenario: I recently inherited my childhood home in Sussex following the death of my father. For sentimental reasons, and because it is bigger than my current home, I would like to move into it with my family. This would mean either selling or renting out my current home. I know that you don't have to pay capital gains tax when you sell your own home, but I'm not clear whether my current home would be classed as my main home if I move into the other property.
data.question: Will I pay capital gains tax if I sell my current home in order to move into an inherited property?
evidences: You don’t pay Capital Gains Tax when you sell your home. You do pay it if you make a profit when you sell a property that isn’t your main home.
If inheriting a property means you own 2 homes, you’ll have to nominate one of them as your main home. You must tell HMRC which property is your main home within 2 years of inheriting the property.
